title: Trunk Impairment Scale
desc: Quantifies disability after stroke; also validated in Parkinson’s disease.

orgreference.text: Verheyden G, Nieuwboer A, Mertin J, Preger R, Kiekens C, De weerdt W. The Trunk Impairment Scale: a new tool to measure motor impairment of the trunk after stroke. Clin Rehabil. 2004;18(3):326-34.

inputs.label_en: Item 1: Patient maintains starting position without support for 10 seconds
inputs.name: sit1

inputs.label_en: Item 2: Therapist crosses unaffected leg over hemiplegic leg
inputs.name: sit2

options.label: Falls or can’t maintain sitting position for 10 seconds without arm support.

inputs.label_en: III. Patient crosses over the hemiplegic leg with the unaffected leg.
inputs.name: sit3

options.label: Can’t cross legs without arm support
Crosses legs but displaces trunk >10 cm backwards or assists crossing with hand
Crosses legs without trunk displacement or assistance

inputs.label_en: Point 1: The patient touches the bed or table with his or her hemiplegic elbow, extending the unaffected side and shortening the hemiplegic side, then returns to the starting position.
inputs.name: dy1

options.label: Falls, needs support from upper extremity, or elbow does not touch the bed or table
Moves actively without help, elbow touches bed or table.
Compensation (with upper extremity, hips, knees, or feet)

inputs.label_en: Item 4: The patient extends his or her hemiplegic side and shortens their unaffected elbow to touch the bed or table before going back to where they were before.
inputs.name: dy4

options.label: Falls, needs support from upper extremity, or elbow doesn’t touch the bed or table
Moves actively without help, elbow touches bed or table
Compensation (with upper extremity, hips, knees, or feet)

inputs.label_en: The seventh item involves lifting the pelvis off the bed or table at the hemiplegic side, extending the unaffected side, and then returning to the starting position.
inputs.name: dy7

inputs.label_en: Go back to item 7 in item 8.
inputs.name: dy8

inputs.label_en: The ninth item involves lifting the pelvis off the bed or table on the unaffected side, extending the hemiplegic side and shortening the unaffected side, and then returning to the starting position.
inputs.name: dy9

inputs.label_en: Item 1: Rotates upper trunk six times (each shoulder moving forward three times); hemiplegic side must move first, with head fixed in placement.
inputs.name: co1

inputs.label_en: Third item: Rotate lower trunk six times (forward three times for each knee); hemiplegic side must move first, with the upper trunk fixed in place.
inputs.name: co3

inputs.label_en: Repeat item 3 in six seconds for item 4.
inputs.name: co4
